comment._content: I know this spot well. The Arcadia - one time dance hall is just out of picture to the right.

comment.author: 44734724@N04
comment._content: Man, defiling creation...and yet sad. I don't need to know this spot itself...I know many likes spewed over the earth and feel one with the moroseness .

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: @Bitter chocolate: Get a grip on your rhetoric: there's nothing defiling or morose about a bunch of happy folks on holiday, enjoying an afternoon at the beach.

comment.author: 44734724@N04
comment._content: Wystan..its all about perspectives....I understand your view as relevant but what i see is just different from what you do...that's not to hard to accept, is it? And just for this time, for you to visualize someone else's sight without calling it "rhetoric", let me show you what I see. What I see is a woman in white, walking with slouched, droopy shoulders, I see a closed casket harboring uncertainties, I see the far away steamliner fuming away,I see children crouching and defecating, I see a mound of garbage dumped in the centre,I see the water turning color from an aquamarine blue to a murky black....sad, and if it didn't write, Antrim county, Ireland on the top..how would you identify it..I would the same way I did earlier..and that's b'cos I have many of its likes, in life, just with people dressed differently, but just the same scene..and that's what I wrote, I am sad for nature and humanity, both..not blaming anyone..I see that. Hope you understand what I wrote, a little better now.
